Yes, max-hops is usually calculated from the seed URIs.

There's no built-in way to do what you want.

You could add some custom code/manual-steps to simulate the same effect. 
The exact best way to do it would vary based on which version of 
Heritrix you're using.

Key points would be:

� do you want '3 hops' from the 'root' page of new sites, or from the 
'entry URL' that was discovered elsewhere

� extra seeds can be added mid-crawl � either via operator actions, or 
by custom code that treats some discovered URLs differently. And, some 
scopes will expand mid-crawl when new seeds are added (though if other 
URLs were already rejected by the narrower scope, they aren't 
reconsidered unless rediscovered).

� the hops-count tests generally use the 'hopsPath' string of 
single-character tokens which each describe one hop -- 'L', 'E', and so 
on. So, part of an automated solution might involve programmatically 
clipping that path when you want to re-start the count when reaching a 
new hostname.

Hope this helps with ideas. If you need other pointers, let me know 
which Heritrix version you're using and more specifics about how you 
want the first URLs into new sites to be treated.

- Gordon @ IA
